title: Beetlejuice
actors: Alec Baldwin, Geena Davis, Annie McEnroe, Maurice Page

actors: Tim Robbins, Morgan Freeman, Bob Gunton, William Sadler
overview: Two imprisoned men bond over a number of years, finding solace and eventual redemption through acts of common decency.

overview: An American reporter goes to the Australian outback to meet an eccentric crocodile poacher and invites him to New York City.

actors: Tom Cruise, Kenneth Branagh, Bill Nighy, Tom Wilkinson

overview: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous restaurant.

overview: Two boys growing up in a violent neighborhood of Rio de Janeiro take different paths: one becomes a photographer, the other a drug dealer.

overview: A man juggles searching for his wife's murderer and keeping his short-term memory loss from being an obstacle.

actors: Rudy Youngblood, Dalia Hernández, Jonathan Brewer, Morris Birdyellowhead
overview: As the Mayan kingdom faces its decline, the rulers insist the key to prosperity is to build more temples and offer human sacrifices. Jaguar Paw, a young man captured for sacrifice, flees to avoid his fate.

actors: Diahnne Abbott, Frank Adu, Victor Argo, Gino Ardito

overview: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

actors: Jessica Biel, John Cleese, Gary Oldman, Dwayne Johnson
overview: An alien civilization is invaded by Astronaut Chuck Baker, who believes that the planet was uninhabited. Wanted by the military, Baker must get back to his ship before it goes into orbit without him.

title: Looper
actors: Joseph Gordon-Levitt, Bruce Willis, Emily Blunt, Paul Dano
overview: In 2074, when the mob wants to get rid of someone, the target is sent into the past, where a hired gun awaits - someone like Joe - who one day learns the mob wants to 'close the loop' by sending back Joe's future self for assassination.

title: Corpse Bride
actors: Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter, Emily Watson, Tracey Ullman
overview: When a shy groom practices his wedding vows in the inadvertent presence of a deceased young woman, she rises from the grave assuming he has married her.

title: The Third Man
actors: Joseph Cotten, Alida Valli, Orson Welles, Trevor Howard
overview: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

title: The Beach
actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Daniel York, Patcharawan Patarakijjanon, Virginie Ledoyen
overview: Twenty-something Richard travels to Thailand and finds himself in possession of a strange map. Rumours state that it leads to a solitary beach paradise, a tropical bliss - excited and intrigued, he sets out to find it.

title: Scarface
actors: Al Pacino, Steven Bauer, Michelle Pfeiffer, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio
overview: In Miami in 1980, a determined Cuban immigrant takes over a drug cartel and succumbs to greed.

title: Sid and Nancy
actors: Gary Oldman, Chloe Webb, David Hayman, Debby Bishop
overview: Morbid biographical story of Sid Vicious, bassist with British punk group the Sex Pistols, and his girlfriend Nancy Spungen. When the Sex Pistols break up after their fateful US tour, ...

actors: Natalie Portman, Mila Kunis, Vincent Cassel, Barbara Hershey

overview: A thief, who steals corporate secrets through use of dream-sharing technology, is given the inverse task of planting an idea into the mind of a CEO.

title: The Silence of the Lambs

overview: A young F.B.I. cadet must confide in an incarcerated and manipulative killer to receive his help on catching another serial killer who skins his victims.

title: Midnight Express

overview: Billy Hayes, an American college student, is caught smuggling drugs out of Turkey and thrown into prison.

actors: Tim Roth, Amanda Plummer, Laura Lovelace, John Travolta

actors: Jason Flemyng, Dexter Fletcher, Nick Moran, Jason Statham
overview: A botched card game in London triggers four friends, thugs, weed-growers, hard gangsters, loan sharks and debt collectors to collide with each other in a series of unexpected events, all for the sake of weed, cash and two antique shotguns.

title: Lucky Number Slevin
actors: Josh Hartnett, Bruce Willis, Lucy Liu, Morgan Freeman
overview: A case of mistaken identity lands Slevin into the middle of a war being plotted by two of the city's most rival crime bosses: The Rabbi and The Boss. Slevin is under constant surveillance by relentless Detective Brikowski as well as the infamous assassin Goodkat and finds himself having to hatch his own ingenious overview to get them before they get him.

title: Rear Window
actors: James Stewart, Grace Kelly, Wendell Corey, Thelma Ritter
overview: A wheelchair-bound photographer spies on his neighbours from his apartment window and becomes convinced one of them has committed murder.

title: Pan's Labyrinth
actors: Ivana Baquero, Sergi López, Maribel Verdú, Doug Jones
overview: In the falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

actors: Leonardo DiCaprio, Mark Ruffalo, Ben Kingsley, Max von Sydow
overview: In 1954, a U.S. marshal investigates the disappearance of a murderess who escaped from a hospital for the criminally insane.

title: Reservoir Dogs
actors: Harvey Keitel, Tim Roth, Michael Madsen, Chris Penn
overview: After a simple jewelry heist goes terribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

title: The Shining
actors: Jack Nicholson, Shelley Duvall, Danny Lloyd, Scatman Crothers
overview: A family heads to an isolated hotel for the winter where an evil and spiritual presence influences the father into violence, while his psychic son sees horrific forebodings from the past and of the future.

title: Midnight in Paris
actors: Owen Wilson, Rachel McAdams, Kurt Fuller, Mimi Kennedy
overview: While on a trip to Paris with his fiancée's family, a nostalgic screenwriter finds himself mysteriously going back to the 1920s everyday at midnight.

title: Les Misérables
actors: Hugh Jackman, Russell Crowe, Anne Hathaway, Amanda Seyfried
overview: In 19th-century France, Jean Valjean, who for decades has been hunted by the ruthless policeman Javert after breaking parole, agrees to care for a factory worker's daughter. The decision changes their lives forever.

title: L.A. Confidential

title: Moneyball
actors: Brad Pitt, Jonah Hill, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Robin Wright

title: The Hangover
actors: Bradley Cooper, Ed Helms, Zach Galifianakis, Justin Bartha
overview: Three buddies wake up from a bachelor party in Las Vegas, with no memory of the previous night and the bachelor missing. They make their way around the city in order to find their friend before his wedding.

title: The Great Beauty
actors: Toni Servillo, Carlo Verdone, Sabrina Ferilli, Carlo Buccirosso
overview: Jep Gambardella has seduced his way through the lavish nightlife of Rome for decades, but after his 65th birthday and a shock from the past, Jep looks past the nightclubs and parties to find a timeless landscape of absurd, exquisite beauty.

title: Gran Torino
actors: Clint Eastwood, Christopher Carley, Bee Vang, Ahney Her
overview: Disgruntled Korean War veteran Walt Kowalski sets out to reform his neighbor, a Hmong teenager who tried to steal Kowalski's prized possession: a 1972 Gran Torino.

title: Mary and Max
actors: Toni Collette, Philip Seymour Hoffman, Barry Humphries, Eric Bana
overview: A tale of friendship between two unlikely pen pals: Mary, a lonely, eight-first_air_date-old girl living in the suburbs of Melbourne, and Max, a forty-four-first_air_date old, severely obese man living in New York.

actors: Nadine Velazquez, Denzel Washington, Carter Cabassa, Adam C. Edwards
overview: An airline pilot saves almost all his passengers on his malfunctioning airliner which eventually crashed, but an investigation into the accident reveals something troubling.

title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
actors: Michael Berryman, Peter Brocco, Dean R. Brooks, Alonzo Brown

actors: Jean Dujardin, Bérénice Bejo, John Goodman, James Cromwell

overview: Forrest Gump, while not intelligent, has accidentally been present at many historic moments, but his true love, Jenny Curran, eludes him.

actors: Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ken Stott
overview: The dwarves, along with Bilbo Baggins and Gandalf the Grey, continue their quest to reclaim Erebor, their homeland, from Smaug. Bilbo Baggins is in possession of a mysterious and magical ring.

actors: Rebecca Hall, Scarlett Johansson, Christopher Evan Welch, Chris Messina

actors: Scarlett Johansson, Bill Murray, Akiko Takeshita, Kazuyoshi Minamimagoe
overview: A faded movie star and a neglected young woman form an unlikely bond after crossing paths in Tokyo.

actors: Jonathan Rhys Meyers, Alexander Armstrong, Paul Kaye, Matthew Goode

overview: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.

overview: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

actors: Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer, Jada Pinkett Smith
overview: Spoiled by their upbringing with no idea what wild life is really like, four animals from New York Central Zoo escape, unwittingly assisted by four absconding penguins, and find themselves in Madagascar, among a bunch of merry lemurs

actors: Jessica Alba, Devon Aoki, Alexis Bledel, Powers Boothe
overview: A film that explores the dark and miserable town, Basin City, and tells the story of three different people, all caught up in violent corruption.

title: Nebraska
actors: Bruce Dern, Will Forte, June Squibb, Bob Odenkirk
overview: An aging, booze-addled father makes the trip from Montana to Nebraska with his estranged son in order to claim a million-dollar Mega Sweepstakes Marketing prize.

title: Shrek
actors: Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, John Lithgow
overview: After his swamp is filled with magical creatures, an ogre agrees to rescue a princess for a villainous lord in order to get his land back.

title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
actors: Brad Pitt, Angelina Jolie, Vince Vaughn, Adam Brody
overview: A bored married couple is surprised to learn that they are both assassins hired by competing agencies to kill each other.

title: Original Sin
actors: Antonio Banderas, Angelina Jolie, Thomas Jane, Jack Thompson
overview: A woman along with her lover, plan to con a rich man by marrying him and on earning his trust running away with all his money. Everything goes as planned until she actually begins to fall in love with him.

title: Shrek Forever After
actors: Mike Myers, Eddie Murphy, Cameron Diaz, Antonio Banderas
overview: Rumpelstiltskin tricks a mid-life crisis burdened Shrek into allowing himself to be erased from existence and cast in a dark alternate timeline where Rumpel rules supreme.

title: Before Midnight
actors: Ethan Hawke, Julie Delpy, Seamus Davey-Fitzpatrick, Jennifer Prior
overview: We meet Jesse and Celine nine years on in Greece. Almost two decades have passed since their first meeting on that train bound for Vienna.

title: Despicable Me
actors: Steve Carell, Jason Segel, Russell Brand, Julie Andrews
overview: When a criminal mastermind uses a trio of orphan girls as pawns for a grand scheme, he finds their love is profoundly changing him for the better.

title: Troy
actors: Julian Glover, Brian Cox, Nathan Jones, Adoni Maropis
overview: An adaptation of Homer's great epic, the film follows the assault on Troy by the united Greek forces and chronicles the fates of the men involved.

title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
actors: Ian McKellen, Martin Freeman, Richard Armitage, Ken Stott
overview: A reluctant hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home - and the gold within it - from the dragon Smaug.

title: The Great Gatsby
actors: Lisa Adam, Frank Aldridge, Amitabh Bachchan, Steve Bisley
overview: A writer and wall street trader, Nick, finds himself drawn to the past and lifestyle of his millionaire neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

title: Ice Age
actors: Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary, Goran Visnjic
overview: Set during the Ice Age, a sabertooth tiger, a sloth, and a wooly mammoth find a lost human infant, and they try to return him to his tribe.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
actors: Alan Howard, Noel Appleby, Sean Astin, Sala Baker
overview: A meek Hobbit from the Shire and eight companions set out on a journey to destroy the powerful One Ring and save Middle Earth from the Dark Lord Sauron.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
actors: Bruce Allpress, Sean Astin, John Bach, Sala Baker
overview: While Frodo and Sam edge closer to Mordor with the help of the shifty Gollum, the divided fellowship makes a stand against Sauron's new ally, Saruman, and his hordes of Isengard.

title: Ex Machina
actors: Domhnall Gleeson, Corey Johnson, Oscar Isaac, Alicia Vikander
overview: A young programmer is selected to participate in a ground-breaking experiment in synthetic intelligence by evaluating the human qualities of a breath-taking humanoid A.I.

title: The Theory of Everything
actors: Eddie Redmayne, Felicity Jones, Tom Prior, Sophie Perry
overview: A look at the relationship between the famous physicist Stephen Hawking and his wife.

title: Shogun
actors: Richard Chamberlain, Toshirô Mifune, Yôko Shimada, Furankî Sakai
overview: A English navigator becomes both a player and pawn in the complex political games in feudal Japan.

title: Spotlight
actors: Mark Ruffalo, Michael Keaton, Rachel McAdams, Liev Schreiber
overview: The true story of how the Boston Globe uncovered the massive scandal of child molestation and cover-up within the local Catholic Archdiocese, shaking the entire Catholic Church to its core.

title: Vertigo
actors: James Stewart, Kim Novak, Barbara Bel Geddes, Tom Helmore
overview: A San Francisco detective suffering from acrophobia investigates the strange activities of an old friend's wife, all the while becoming dangerously obsessed with her.

title: Whiplash
actors: Miles Teller, J.K. Simmons, Paul Reiser, Melissa Benoist
overview: A promising young drummer enrolls at a cut-throat music conservatory where his dreams of greatness are mentored by an instructor who will stop at nothing to realize a student's potential.

title: The Lives of Others
actors: Martina Gedeck, Ulrich Mühe, Sebastian Koch, Ulrich Tukur
overview: In 1984 East Berlin, an agent of the secret police, conducting surveillance on a writer and his lover, finds himself becoming increasingly absorbed by their lives.

title: Hotel Rwanda
actors: Xolani Mali, Don Cheadle, Desmond Dube, Hakeem Kae-Kazim
overview: Paul Rusesabagina was a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.

title: The Martian
actors: Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig, Jeff Daniels
overview: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars after his team assume him dead, and must rely on his ingenuity to find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
actors: Gregory Peck, John Megna, Frank Overton, Rosemary Murphy
overview: Atticus Finch, a lawyer in the Depression-era South, defends a black man against an undeserved rape charge, and his kids against prejudice.

title: The Hateful Eight
actors: Samuel L. Jackson, Kurt Russell, Jennifer Jason Leigh, Walton Goggins
overview: In the dead of a Wyoming winter, a bounty hunter and his prisoner find shelter in a cabin currently inhabited by a collection of nefarious characters.

title: A Separation
actors: Peyman Moaadi, Leila Hatami, Sareh Bayat, Shahab Hosseini
overview: A married couple are faced with a difficult decision - to improve the life of their child by moving to another country or to stay in Iran and look after a deteriorating parent who has Alzheimer's disease.

title: The Big Short
actors: Ryan Gosling, Rudy Eisenzopf, Casey Groves, Charlie Talbert
overview: Four denizens in the world of high-finance predict the credit and housing bubble collapse of the mid-2000s, and decide to take on the big banks for their greed and lack of foresight.
